DOW CHEMICAL, Midland, Mich., said that its wholly owned seed company, Mycogen Seeds, would buy the assets of Cargill Hybrid Seeds from the Minneapolis based agribusiness company, Cargill Inc., creating the No. 3 seed-corn producer in the United States. Terms of the deal were not disclosed,

SBA COMMUNICATIONS, Boca Raton, Fla., which owns and operates antenna towers, said it would acquire as many as 275 towers from TeleCorp PCS, an affiliate of the AT&T Wireless Group. The towers are in Louisiana, Tennessee, Mississippi, Arkansas and Puerto Rico. Under the agreement, SBA will buy 213 to 275 towers for $327,000 each.

AMERICAN UNION INSURANCE, Indianapolis, raised its takeover bid for the Indianapolis-based Meridian Insurance Group to $25 a share and said it would seek only a 50.1 percent stake in the company. Last week, Meridian rejected a $20 a share offer from American Union that valued the company at $157 million.
